discussion.content: Answer is C,Action Center has a new name and a new home. Please start using the new and improved Restricted Users page in the Security & Compliance Center. Read about the new Restricted Users experience.

Correct Answer is C. Actually there are two Ways to Access Restricted Users from Security & Compliance:
1. Alerts->Dashboard->Other Alerts-> Restricted Users
2. Threat Management->Review->Restricted Users
Are you sure about this? Because Office 365 Security & Compliance Threat management is something is then Office 365 Security & Compliance Restrictedusers page

discussion.content:
In the Security & Compliance Center, go to Alerts > Alert policies.

Find an select the User restricted from sending email alert.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.
A user attempts to send an email message to an external recipient and receives the following error message: "Your message couldn't be delivered because you weren't recognized as a valid sender. The most common reason for this is that your email address is suspected of sending spam and it's no longer allowed to send messages outside of your organization. Contact your mail admin for assistance. Remote Server returned "Ëœ550 5.1.8 Access denied, bad outbound sender'."
You need to ensure that the user send email to external recipients.
What should you do?

choices.D: action center in the Exchange admin center
choices.B: Data loss prevention in the Security & Compliance admin center
choices.A: compliance management in the Exchange admin center
choices.C: Threat management in the Security & Compliance admin center

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Exchange Server 2019 organization that contains 1,000 users and three Mailbox servers.
You discover an increase in spam.
You need to use an anti-spam real-time block list.
What should you do first?

discussion.content:
Correct answer is 'D'. 
It may seem like the thing you should do 'first' is install and enable agents on the mailbox server(s). But the requirement is to explicitly enable RBL - real time block lists.
RBLs are only supported in the 'connection filtering' agent. See here for custom RBL provider configuration:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/antispam-and-antimalware/antispam-protection/connection-filtering-procedures?view=exchserver-2019#ip-block-list-provider-procedures

comments.content:
according to your ref. B should be the correct answer. 
Content Filter agent: Content filtering agent assigns a spam confidence level (SCL) to each message based on data from legitimate and spam messages. For more information, see Content filtering.

Spam quarantine is a component of the Content Filter agent that reduces the risk of losing legitimate messages that are incorrectly classified as spam. Spam quarantine provides a temporary storage location for suspicious messages so an administrator can review the messages. For more information, see Spam quarantine in Exchange Server.

discussion.content: The right answer is D. Deploy an Edge Transport server. Only Edge has Connection Filtering agent. https://docs.microsoft.com/ru-ru/exchange/antispam-and-antimalware/antispam-protection/antispam-protection?view=exchserver-2019
The Add-IPBlockListProvider is available only on Edge=> :D

B is correct answer. By default, the anti-spam agents are not installed and hooked into transport service. However, by running the script, we can enable the agent with transport service. 

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/Exchange/antispam-and-antimalware/antispam-protection/antispam-on-mailbox-servers?view=exchserver-2019

choices.A: Configure the junk email settings for the mailboxes.
choices.C: Deploy a data loss prevention (DLP) policy.

discussion.content:
No
Personal Tag are applied by the user it does not enforce which mean this will not help.

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You have a Microsoft Exchange Server 2019 organization.
You discover that users rarely delete items from their Sent Items folder and their Deleted Items folder.
You need to recommend a solution to automatically reduce the size on the primary mailbox of each user.
Solution: You recommend configuring a retention policy that contains two personal tags.
Does this meet the goal?

HOTSPOT -
Your company has a Microsoft 365 subscription.
All users are assigned Microsoft 365 E5 licenses.
The users receive email messages that appear to come from managers at the company. However, the messages are not from the managers and often include links to malicious websites.
You need to provide a solution to protect the mailboxes of the managers and to inform the users when phishing occurs.
Which two settings should you modify in the anti-phishing policy? To answer, select the appropriate settings in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
We need to "inform the users when phishing occurs". 
'Action' doesn't have this option, so we need to modify 'Safety tips > User impersonation'.

You need to ensure that all users receive a daily email message that contains a list of spam-quarantined email messages.

discussion.content: You can also go to SCC>Threat Management>Policy>Anti-Spam Policy and there is the same option to Configure end-user spam notification.

questions.answer_description:
You need to enable end-user spam notifications for the default spam policy.
1. Go to the Exchange Admin Center.
2. Click Protection in the left navigation pane.
3. Click "ËœSpam Filter'.
4. Select the default spam policy.
5. In the right pane, where the summary information about the spam policy appears, click the "ËœConfigure End-user spam notifications' link.
6. Tick the checkbox labelled "ËœEnable end-user spam notifications'.
7. Click Save to save the changes.
